title: Taylor Swift praises Selena Gomez's new song'... after she drops a farewell to Justin Bieber
text:
Taylor Swift is never shy about celebrating her friends.

And after Selena Gomez released a heart wrenching ballad on Tuesday, the Lover singer was sure to shout her out.

Taylor called the new song—Lose You to Love Me— ' triumph,' when she shared it to her Instagram stories.

Best yet: And after Selena Gomez released a heart wrenching ballad on Tuesday, Taylor Swift was sure to shout her out on Instagram

The 29-year-old singer shared the song's cover, a black and white portrait of Selena, and said 'I love you so much @selenagomez.'

She continued: 'This song is a perfect expression of healing and my absolute favorite song she's put out yet. A triumph.'

The lady's friendship began in 2008 when they were dating Jonas Brothers (Joe and Taylor and Nick and Selena).

They often support each other's projects. Selena even joined Taylor on stage im 2015 during her 1989 tour and in 2018 during her Reputation tour.

Growth: She said: 'This song is a perfect expression of healing and my absolute favorite song she's put out yet. A triumph' (pictured in 2016)

Longtime friends: The lady's friendship began in 2008 when they were dating Jonas Brothers (Joe and Taylor and Nick and Selena) (onstage in 2018)

Lose You to Love Me is a very emotional and personal song about healing after a relationship, ends and marks the Disney star's first solo musical release in four years.

Fans have been speculating the song is about saying goodbye to her ex Justin Bieber and closing the door on that chapter of her life - with the lyrics including a line about Selena being 'replaced' within two months.

Justin got back together with his now wife Hailey Baldwin just two months after he parted ways from Selena in 2017.

Revealing she is feeling stronger and more confident now that she's single, the chorus goes: 'We'd always go into it blindly / I needed to lose you to find me / This dancing was killing me softly / I needed to hate you to love me, yeah'.

'In two months, you replaced us': Selena Gomez's new song Lose You To Love Me contains poignant lyrics which appear to be a clear reference to her turbulent relationship with Justin Bieber

Selena's new lyrics hint at a toxic relationship and someone taking pleasure in hurting her.

However, the clearest clue comes with the line: 'You turned me down and now it's showing / In two months, you replaced us / Like it was easy / Made me think I deserved it.'

Justin and Selena's love story began in 2010 and they had a famously turbulent on/off relationship for years.

They got back together in 2017 only to split in March 2018 - but by July Justin was already engaged to his wife Hailey Baldwin.

Moving on: Justin got engaged to his wife Hailey Baldwin just two months after he parted ways from Selena in 2018. They tied the knot privately in September 2018, just three months after their whirlwind engagement, and have just thrown a second star-studded wedding one year later

Bieber and Hailey had been linked since 2014 and confirmed their romance in January 2016, only to split a few months later - before rekindling things immediately after his final split from Selena.

They tied the knot privately in September 2018, just three months after their whirlwind engagement, and have just thrown a second star-studded wedding one year later.

The Lose You To Lose Me video, also released Tuesday, was filmed in black and white, entirely on an iPhone, with the close up shots mirroring her introspective state of mind.

Explaining the highly personal meaning behind the song, she wrote: 'This song was inspired by many things that have happened in my life since releasing my last album.

Less is more: It was directed by Sophie Muller, whose other credits include Beyonce, Gwen Stefani, Maroon 5, Shakira and Coldplay

Range of emotions: The Lose You To Lose Me video has been filmed in black and white, entirely on an iPhone, with the close up shots mirroring her introspective state of mind

'I thought it was important to share the music, as I know many can relate to the fact that the road to self-discovery generally comes through the scars in one's life.

'I want people to feel hope and to know you will come out the other side stronger and a better version of yourself. '

Gomez co-wrote the song with frequent collaborators Julia Michaels, Justin Tranter and producers Mattman & Robin.

The video was directed by Sophie Muller, whose other credits include Beyonce, Gwen Stefani, Maroon 5, Shakira and Coldplay.

Spiritual journey: Selena also shared an inspirational message about her spiritual journey as she dropped the video
